p: Polysaccharides obtained from the seeds of C. quinoa Willd. are considered to be excellent dietary sources of natural antioxidants promoting human health through immune-system modification ( 174). Purified polysaccharides from the plant have been further reported to exhibit immunomodulation activity by increasing macrophage proliferation and suppression of NO production on inflammatory RAW264.7, in addition to antioxidant and anticancer properties ( 175). Quinoa saponins such as phytolaccagenic, oleanolic and serjanic acids, hederagenin, 3β,23,30 trihydroxy olean-12-en-28-oic acid, 3β-hydroxy-27-oxo-olean-12en-28-oic acid, and 3β,23,30 trihydroxy olean-12-en-28-oic acid exhibit molluscicidal, antifungal, anti-inflammatory, hemolytic, and cytotoxic activities ( 176).
